main event: An unidentified white, pulsating light was observed by military personnel over the south end of runway 22 at Pope AFB, North Carolina on June 9, 1965.
interesting points: The object was visible for 3-4 seconds and moved faster than any aircraft the observers had ever seen.
The object increased in luminosity and velocity, reaching 13 knots at 10,000 feet before decreasing to 15,000 feet.
No sound was heard from the object.
The weather conditions at the time were clear with 3-5 miles of visibility.
The investigating officer was unable to find any physical evidence or logical explanation for the sighting.
witnesses: military personnel, including Capt. Robert Tatge Bacon, Roland G. AP133, and Alc Watt, W. G., AP135*1823
